artists.name: Leonardo da Vinci
artists.information: Leonardo da Vinci was an Italian polymath of the Renaissance. He was a painter, sculptor, architect, scientist, mathematician, and writer.

artists.name: Vincent van Gogh
artists.information: Vincent van Gogh was a Dutch post-impressionist painter who is among the most famous and influential figures in the history of Western art.

artists.name: Pablo Picasso
artists.information: Pablo Picasso was a Spanish painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, and stage designer who spent most of his adult life in France.

artists.name: Claude Monet
artists.information: Claude Monet was a French painter, a founder of French Impressionist painting, and the most consistent and prolific practitioner of the movement's philosophy.

artists.name: Frida Kahlo
artists.information: Frida Kahlo was a Mexican painter known for her many portraits, self-portraits, and works inspired by the nature and artifacts of Mexico.

artists.name: Rembrandt van Rijn
artists.information: Rembrandt van Rijn was a Dutch painter and etcher. He is generally considered one of the most important and influential artists in the history of art.

artists.name: Georgia O'Keeffe
artists.information: Georgia O'Keeffe was an American artist. She was known for her paintings of enlarged flowers, New York skyscrapers, and New Mexico landscapes.

artists.name: Salvador Dali
artists.information: Salvador Dalí was a Spanish surrealist painter known for his striking and bizarre images. He was also a sculptor, filmmaker, and writer.

artists.name: Michelangelo Buonarroti
artists.information: Michelangelo di Lodovico Buonarroti Simoni was an Italian sculptor, painter, architect, poet, and engineer of the High Renaissance.

artists.name: Camille Pissarro
artists.information: Jacob Abraham Camille Pissarro was a Danish-French Impressionist and Neo-Impressionist painter born on the island of St Thomas (now in the US Virgin Islands, but then in the Danish West Indies).

artists.name: Gustav Klimt
artists.information: Gustav Klimt was an Austrian symbolist painter and one of the most prominent members of the Vienna Secession movement.

artists.name: Diego Rivera
artists.information: Diego María de la Concepción Juan Nepomuceno Estanislao de la Rivera y Barrientos Acosta y Rodríguez, known as Diego Rivera, was a prominent Mexican painter.

artists.name: Edvard Munch
artists.information: Edvard Munch was a Norwegian painter and printmaker. His best-known work, The Scream (1893), has become an iconic image of existential angst.

artists.name: Johannes Vermeer
artists.information: Johannes Vermeer was a Dutch Baroque Period painter who specialized in domestic interior scenes of middle-class life.

artists.name: Auguste Rodin
artists.information: François Auguste René Rodin was a French sculptor generally considered the founder of modern sculpture.

artists.name: Andy Warhol
artists.information: Andy Warhol was an American artist, director, and producer who was a leading figure in the visual art movement known as pop art.

artists.name: Titian
artists.information: Tiziano Vecelli or Tiziano Vecellio, known in English as Titian, was an Italian painter, the most important member of the 16th-century Venetian school.

artists.name: Marc Chagall
artists.information: Marc Zakharovich Chagall was a Russian-French artist. An early modernist, he was associated with several major artistic styles.

artists.name: Mary Cassatt
artists.information: Mary Stevenson Cassatt was an American painter and printmaker. She was born in Allegheny City, Pennsylvania (now part of Pittsburgh).

artists.name: Diego Velázquez
artists.information: Diego Rodríguez de Silva y Velázquez was a Spanish painter, the leading artist in the court of King Philip IV, and one of the most important painters of the Spanish Golden Age.

artists.name: Egon Schiele
artists.information: Egon Schiele was an Austrian painter. A protégé of Gustav Klimt, Schiele was a major figurative painter of the early 20th century.

artists.name: Grant Wood
artists.information: Grant DeVolson Wood was an American painter best known for his paintings depicting the rural American Midwest.

artists.name: Amedeo Modigliani
artists.information: Amedeo Clemente Modigliani was an Italian Jewish painter and sculptor who worked mainly in France.

artists.name: Joan Miró
artists.information: Joan Miró i Ferrà was a Spanish painter, sculptor, and ceramicist born in Barcelona. A museum dedicated to his work, the Fundació Joan Miró, was established in his native city of Barcelona in 1975.

artists.name: Paul Cézanne
artists.information: Paul Cézanne was a French artist and Post-Impressionist painter whose work laid the foundations of the transition from the 19th-century conception of artistic endeavor to a new and radically different world of art in the 20th century.
